text: Pre-Lecture Quiz, Chapter 29, Skeletal Muscle, Bone, and Joint Disorder Drugs True/False 1. Skeletal muscle relaxants are used during surgical procedures to facilitate body positioning. 2. DMARDs are used to increase the function of patients with chronic musculoskeletal conditions. 3. Bone resorption inhibitors are used to treat osteoporosis. 4. When prescribing a DMARD, clients should be prescreened for autoimmune disorders. 5. Bisphosphonates are typically prescribed for about 5 years. Fill in the Blank 1. ____________ is the most common adverse reaction of skeletal muscle relaxants. 2. Early stage rheumatoid arthritis is usually treated with ____________ drugs. 3. Allopurinol reduces the production of uric acid, decreasing the deposit of __________ crystals in ___________, which causes pain. 4. In RA treatment, the DMARDs are used to suppress the ____________ system. 5. ___________ are drugs used to treat musculoskeletal disorders such as osteoporosis and Paget disease.
